title: Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super vs AMD RX 6900 XT: Does AMD lose?
text: Which GPU triumphs? PC Guide is reader-supported. When you buy through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Prices subject to change. Read More Last Updated on January 27, 2024 The battle between Nvidia and AMD continues to captivate PC enthusiasts. At the forefront of this rivalry is the latest showdown: Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super vs. AMD RX 6900 XT. Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super, part of the advanced RTX 40 Super series, hit the market on January 24th, 2024, boasting groundbreaking AI capabilities. This new entrant raises a compelling question: how does it stack up against AMD’s powerful RX 6900 XT? In our comprehensive guide, we delve deep into this matchup, scrutinizing every aspect of these two graphics behemoths to determine which reigns supreme in enhancing your PC’s performance and compatibility. Read on for a detailed exploration of Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super vs. AMD RX 6900 XT, to uncover which of these graphics cards earns the crown in the fiercely competitive arena of high-end gaming and professional applications. When evaluating the Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super and AMD RX 6900 XT, it’s essential to delve into their technical specs. These components lay the foundation for performance and compatibility, playing a pivotal role in the gaming and creative workflows of PCs. Let’s compare these two graphic powerhouses to see how they stack up in architecture, clock speeds, memory, and core counts. The architecture and transistor count of a graphics card are fundamental in defining its capabilities. The Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super steps forward with its advanced Ada Lovelace architecture, utilizing a 5nm process and housing a substantial 45,900 million transistors. This leap in GPU technology marks a significant advance and enhances motherboard compatibility, fitting seamlessly into various PC builds. In contrast, AMD’s RX 6900 XT is built on the RDNA 2.0 architecture with a 7nm process, containing 26,800 million transistors. Though it may trail slightly in transistor count, it remains a robust contender in the hardware landscape. Clock speeds are a battleground for these GPU titans. The RTX 4070 Ti Super showcases its prowess with a base clock of 2340 MHz and a boost clock of 2610 MHz, overshadowing the RX 6900 XT’s 1825 MHz base and 2250 MHz boost clocks. This gap highlights the RTX 4070 Ti Super’s superior processing efficiency and rapid response capabilities, crucial for demanding applications. When it comes to memory, both GPUs pack a punch with 16 GB of VRAM and a 256-bit memory bus. However, Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super takes a slight lead with a memory bandwidth of 672.3 GB/s, compared to AMD’s 512.0 GB/s. This advantage is pivotal in handling memory-intensive tasks, bolstered by Nvidia’s DLSS technology for enhanced performance. Diving deeper into the GPUs’ components, we see Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super featuring an impressive 8448 shading units and 66 SM count. This outperforms AMD’s RX 6900 XT, which comes with 5120 shading units and 80 SM count. The higher tensor and cache capacities in Nvidia’s GPU further cement its position as a leader in managing complex graphical computations and AI-driven processes. When it comes to raw performance, the Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super and AMD RX 6900 XT are both heavy hitters in the GPU arena. The RTX 4070 Ti Super, part of the Nvidia GeForce RTX lineup, stands out with its state-of-the-art Ada Lovelace architecture and advanced features. This GPU excels in rendering complex visual effects, thanks to its higher RT cores count, which significantly boosts ray tracing capabilities. When ray tracing is enabled, the RTX 4070 Ti Super enhances visual fidelity and maintains smooth frame rates, a crucial factor for a seamless gaming experience. On the other side, the AMD RX 6900 XT, driven by the robust RDNA 2 architecture, showcases its might in both rasterization and ray-traced rendering. The GPU benefits from AMD’s continuous driver optimizations and efficient power management, translating into remarkable performance. Especially in games where ray tracing isn’t the primary focus, the RX 6900 XT impresses with its capability to handle demanding graphics with ease. When comparing the average fps (frames per second) delivered by both GPUs, the Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super frequently takes the lead. In popular titles like Cyberpunk 2077, played at 4K resolution, the RTX 4070 Ti Super achieves an average of around 60 FPS, whereas the RX 6900 XT trails with approximately 45 FPS. This performance gap is also evident in games like Assassin’s Creed Valhalla, where the RTX 4070 Ti Super clocks over 100 FPS, surpassing the RX 6900 XT’s average of around 90 FPS. The boost clock speeds of the RTX 4070 Ti Super contribute significantly to its performance edge. Combined with Nvidia’s deep learning super sampling (DLSS) technology, the GPU renders high-quality images and maintains higher frame rates. DLSS, using AI and machine learning algorithms, smartly upscales lower-resolution images to higher resolutions, providing a balance between image quality and performance. Overall, when considering the role of a performance GPU in modern gaming setups, the Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti Super emerges as a slightly more powerful contender compared to the AMD RX 6900 XT. Its advanced ray tracing capabilities, higher frame rates, and innovative features like DLSS make it a preferred choice for gamers and enthusiasts who prioritize top-tier performance. In the battle of price and value between Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super and AMD’s RX 6900 XT, discerning the better deal becomes crucial for consumers. Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super, priced at a competitive $799, emerges as a remarkably value-packed offering. This price point, while delivering top-tier performance, is particularly appealing for those looking to upgrade their devices without straining their finances. On the other side, AMD’s RX 6900 XT, with a price tag of $999, stands at a higher spectrum of the market. Although it’s a formidable GPU in its own right, the price difference is significant when considering the similar caliber of performance both GPUs offer. This makes the RTX 4070 Ti Super a more budget-friendly option, providing excellent performance per dollar spent. Consumers weighing their options should keep an eye on the latest prices, as fluctuations in the market could affect the cost-benefit analysis between these two GPUs. Ultimately, for those seeking top-notch performance with a more accessible price tag, Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super could be the smarter investment, offering substantial value for its price. In the epic showdown between Nvidia’s RTX 4070 Ti Super and AMD’s RX 6900 XT, Nvidia emerges as the undisputed victor. It showcases technological innovation, superior performance, and exceptional value for money. While AMD’s offering remains a commendable contender in its own right, Nvidia’s relentless pursuit of excellence sets a new benchmark for high-performance graphics computing, solidifying its reign as the industry leader in GPU technology.
